thread.title: Auckland house sellers asking $300K more than 5 years ago
thread.title_full: Auckland house sellers asking $300K more than 5 years ago

title: Auckland house sellers asking $300K more than 5 years ago
text:
Auckland house sellers asking $300K more than 5 years ago 
  3:13 p.m. 
Auckland's rampant property market has led to the average asking price rising by $300,000 in just five years, according to research. 
Trade Me's Property Price Index puts the average asking price in New Zealand's biggest city last month at $776,000. 
Since September 2013 prices have risen by $200,000 after growing by $100,000 over the previous three years. 
"Just when you think the Auckland property market can't surprise you any further, another incredible statistic emerges," said Head of Trade Me Property Nigel Jeffries. 
The 63 percent five-year gain in Auckland is not repeated elsewhere with prices rising by 19.2 percent over the same period outside the region. 
The national average asking price last month was $567,000 but that fell to $408,650 when Auckland was excluded. 
AUCKLAND'S AVERAGE ASKING PROPERTY PRICE: Sept 2010 - $476,000 Sept 2011 - $504,500 - up 6 percent Sept 2012 - $532,300 - up 5 percent Sept 2013 - $588,150 - up 10 percent Sept 2014 - $649,000 - up 10 percent Sept 2015 - $776,000 - up 20 percent 
Source: Trade Me Property Price Index 
NZN
